title: EnglishPod 初级 英文播客 0008

segments.en: Hello, English learners, and welcome back to EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 你好，英语学习者，欢迎回到EnglishPod。

segments.en: Marco, I'm doing really well today.
Uh-huh, we've got a great lesson for everyone.
segments.cn: 嗯，我们有一个很棒的课程给大家。

segments.en: Yes, we have a really common situation where we're going to use real English, right?
segments.cn: 是的，我们有一个非常常见的情境，我们将使用真实的英语，对吗？

segments.en: Yep, everyday English, English that people really use.
segments.cn: 是的，日常英语，人们真正使用的英语。

segments.en: And that's what we want you to learn.
segments.cn: 这就是我们希望你学习的。

segments.en: What are we talking about today specifically?
segments.cn: 今天我们具体要谈什么？

segments.en: Today we have a really common situation that is a little bit embarrassing.
segments.cn: 今天我们有一个非常常见的情境，有点尴尬。

segments.en: Alright, an embarrassing situation, so let's listen to the dialogue for the first time and it's going to be kind of fast.
segments.cn: 好吧，一个尴尬的情境，所以我们先听一次对话，速度会有点快。

segments.en: Yeah, but don't worry if you don't understand everything, because after 10 minutes, you'll understand everything.
segments.cn: 是的，但如果你不理解所有内容也不用担心，因为10分钟后你会理解一切。

segments.en: Actually, my office is right around the corner.
segments.cn: 其实，我的办公室就在拐角处。

segments.en: It was great to meet you last week at the conference.
segments.cn: 上周在会议上见到你很高兴。

segments.en: I really enjoyed our conversation about foreign investment.
segments.cn: 我真的很享受我们关于外国投资的对话。

segments.en: Yeah, yeah, it was really interesting.
You know, I'm in a bit of a hurry, but here's my card.
segments.cn: 你知道，我有点赶，但这是我的名片。

segments.en: We should definitely meet up again and continue our discussion.
segments.cn: 我们一定要再见面，继续我们的讨论。

segments.en: Sure, you still have my contact details, right?
segments.cn: 当然，你还记得我的联系方式，对吧？

segments.en: This is really embarrassing, but your name has just slipped my mind.
segments.cn: 这真的很尴尬，但我刚刚忘了你的名字。

segments.en: Sure, my name is Anna Faris.
It happens to me all the time.
Yeah, that's happened to me a couple of times and I'm going to tell you about it a little bit later.
segments.cn: 是的，这种事我也发生过几次，稍后我会告诉你。

segments.en: Okay, alright, well, let's start with our three language takeaways.
segments.cn: 好的，好吧，我们先来看看我们的三个语言要点。

segments.en: So our first word on our takeaway is in a bit of a hurry.
segments.cn: 我们的第一个要点是有点赶。

segments.en: In a bit of a hurry.
In a bit of a hurry.
In a bit of a hurry.
So Nick was in a hurry.
So let's listen to three examples of how you can use this phrase.
segments.cn: 让我们听听三个使用这个短语的例子。

segments.en: I'm in a bit of a hurry.
I'm in a bit of a hurry.
I'm in a bit of a hurry, so I'll check these files later.
segments.cn: 我有点赶，所以我稍后再检查这些文件。

segments.en: Basically, it means that you don't have time.
segments.cn: 基本上，这意味着你没有时间。

segments.en: Now let's look at our second language takeaway word, and it's contact details.
segments.cn: 现在让我们看看我们的第二个语言要点，联系方式。

segments.en: So what are your contact details?
segments.cn: 那么你的联系方式是什么？

segments.en: Basically, this is the information you can find on your business card.
segments.cn: 基本上，这是你在名片上可以找到的信息。

segments.en: Alright, so we have like our name, our telephone number.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们有我们的名字、电话号码。

segments.en: Your email address, perhaps your mobile phone number.
segments.cn: 你的电子邮件地址，也许还有你的手机号码。

segments.en: So all the useful information so people can get in touch with you.
segments.cn: 所以所有有用的信息，以便人们可以联系你。

segments.en: So people can phone you or email you.
segments.cn: 所以人们可以打电话给你或发邮件给你。

segments.en: Okay, so our third word is slipped my mind.
segments.cn: 好的，我们的第三个词是忘记了。

segments.en: So this is a funny phrase.
Okay, so now we're going to listen to two examples of this phrase.
segments.cn: 好的，现在我们要听两个这个短语的例子。

segments.en: Try and see if you can figure out what it means.
segments.cn: 尝试看看你能否弄明白它的意思。

segments.en: I'm sorry I forgot to respond to your email.
segments.cn: 对不起，我忘了回复你的邮件。

segments.en: Don't you know what day it is today?
segments.cn: 你不知道今天是什么日子吗？

segments.en: Ah, so slipped my mind is like, I forgot.
segments.cn: 啊，所以忘记了就像，我忘了。

segments.en: Now it's time for putting it together.
segments.cn: 现在是时候把它们结合起来了。

segments.en: All right, Erika, why don't you tell our listeners what putting it together is?
segments.cn: 好吧，Erika，为什么不告诉我们的听众什么是把它们结合起来？

segments.en: Well, putting it together helps you put language together.
segments.cn: 好吧，把它们结合起来帮助你把语言结合在一起。

segments.en: It helps you be more fluent by knowing how words fit together.
segments.cn: 它帮助你通过了解单词如何组合在一起来变得更加流利。

segments.en: Great, so let's look at our first phrase today.
segments.cn: 很好，所以让我们看看今天的第一个短语。

segments.en: So this is like, close by.
I can say, for example, is there a bank around here?
segments.cn: 我可以说，比如，这附近有银行吗？

segments.en: So that's, is there a bank close to here?
segments.cn: 所以就是，这附近有银行吗？

segments.en: Now, this phrase, around here, we can change it a little bit.
segments.cn: 现在，这个短语，附近，我们可以稍微改一下。

segments.en: And it means something a little bit different.
I could say, Marco, there's a great restaurant right around the corner.
segments.cn: 我可以说，Marco，这附近有一家很棒的餐厅。

segments.en: Right, and that would mean there is a great restaurant on the other street.
segments.cn: 对，这意味着在另一条街上有一家很棒的餐厅。
或者我们有另一个例子。

segments.en: So for example, I can say, Los Angeles is a great city.
segments.cn: 比如，我可以说，洛杉矶是个很棒的城市。

segments.en: I used to live around there.
So you used to live near Los Angeles.
segments.cn: 所以你以前住在洛杉矶附近。

segments.en: It's a really good phrase, and it's really common.
segments.cn: 这是个很好的短语，而且非常常见。

segments.en: Now our next phrase in putting it together is terrible with.
segments.cn: 现在我们下一个短语是“对……很糟糕”。

segments.en: So we have a couple of examples that will show you how this phrase works.
segments.cn: 所以我们有几个例子来展示这个短语是如何运作的。

segments.en: You can't even remember your own telephone number.
segments.cn: 你连自己的电话号码都记不住。

segments.en: I can never remember what people look like.
segments.cn: 我从来记不住人长什么样。

segments.en: I can barely add two plus two.
Well, yeah, I guess not everyone is a numbers person.
segments.cn: 嗯，是的，我想不是每个人都是数字型的人。

segments.en: I sometimes forget what people look like.
segments.cn: 我有时会忘记人长什么样。

segments.en: So I think it's time now for us to listen to our dialogue a second time.
segments.cn: 所以我想现在是时候让我们再听一遍对话了。

segments.en: Okay, this time the dialogue will be a little bit slower.
segments.cn: 好的，这次对话会慢一点。

segments.en: So try and listen for some of the words we've just talked about.
segments.cn: 所以试着听听我们刚刚谈到的一些词。

segments.en: What are you doing in this neighborhood?
Actually, my office is right around the corner.
segments.cn: 实际上，我的办公室就在拐角处。

segments.en: It was great to meet you last week at the conference.
segments.cn: 上周在会议上见到你很高兴。

segments.en: I really enjoyed our conversation about foreign investment.
segments.cn: 我真的很享受我们关于外国投资的对话。

segments.en: Yeah, yeah, it was really interesting.
You know, I'm in a bit of a hurry, but here's my card.
segments.cn: 你知道，我有点赶时间，但这是我的名片。

segments.en: We should definitely meet up again and continue our discussion.
segments.cn: 我们一定要再见面，继续我们的讨论。

segments.en: You still have my contact details, right?
segments.cn: 你还记得我的联系方式，对吧？

segments.en: This is really embarrassing, but your name has just slipped my mind.
segments.cn: 这真的很尴尬，但我刚刚忘了你的名字。

segments.en: It happens to me all the time.
You can understand a lot better, right?
So now it's time for us to take a look at Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 现在是时候让我们看看流利度提升器了。

segments.en: So with Fluency Builder, we take some very simple phrases and show you how you can be more fluent or how you can sound more native.
segments.cn: 在流利度提升器中，我们会用一些非常简单的短语来展示你如何变得更流利，或者如何听起来更像本地人。

segments.en: In the beginning of the dialogue, Ana said, Nick, how's it going?
segments.cn: 在对话开始时，Ana说，Nick，最近怎么样？

segments.en: Yeah, this is a great phrase.
segments.cn: 是的，这是个很好的短语。

segments.en: You know, sometimes I hear students say, how are you or how are you doing?
segments.cn: 你知道，有时我听到学生说，你好吗或者你最近怎么样？

segments.en: Those are two great phrases, but this one sounds really, really natural.
segments.cn: 这两个短语都很好，但这个听起来真的很自然。

segments.en: Yeah, let's listen again to that phrase from the dialogue.
segments.cn: 是的，让我们再听一遍对话中的那个短语。

segments.en: So next time that you find a friend on the street, you can just say, hey, how's it going?
segments.cn: 所以下次你在街上遇到朋友时，你可以直接说，嘿，最近怎么样？

segments.en: So Marco, have you ever forgotten someone's name?
segments.cn: 所以Marco，你有没有忘记过某人的名字？

segments.en: Yeah, it's happened to me a couple of times.
And actually, the most embarrassing situation was that I forgot a family member's name.
segments.cn: 其实，最尴尬的情况是我忘记了一个家庭成员的名字。
不，一个家庭成员的名字。

segments.en: We had like a family reunion and there were a lot of aunts and uncles and cousins that I hadn't seen in a while.
segments.cn: 我们有过一次家庭聚会，有很多我很久没见的阿姨、叔叔和表亲。

segments.en: And I just forgot one of my uncle's names.
segments.cn: 我就是忘记了我一个叔叔的名字。

segments.en: Well, I had to ask one of my other cousins.
segments.cn: 嗯，我不得不问我的另一个表亲。

segments.en: I'm like, hey, who is that guy?
He's like, oh, that's Uncle John.
segments.cn: 他回答说，哦，那是约翰叔叔。

segments.en: I'm like, oh, man, I totally forgot.
segments.cn: 我说，哦，天哪，我完全忘了。

segments.en: So it was really embarrassing because I didn't know what to call him.
segments.cn: 所以这真的很尴尬，因为我不知道该怎么称呼他。

segments.en: So I just called him Uncle because I didn't know his name.
segments.cn: 所以我就叫他叔叔，因为我不知道他的名字。

segments.en: So when that happens to me, when I'm in a business setting, sometimes what I do is I ask for someone's card.
segments.cn: 所以当这种情况发生在我身上时，在商务场合，有时我会要求对方给我名片。

segments.en: Or sometimes I might ask them to write down their email because usually their full name is spelled out on their email address.
segments.cn: 或者有时我会请他们写下他们的电子邮件，因为通常他们的全名会在电子邮件地址上拼写出来。

segments.en: So that's my trick when I've forgotten someone's name.
segments.cn: 所以这是我忘记某人名字时的小窍门。

segments.en: And I guess a lot of our listeners can take your advice on that.
segments.cn: 我想我们的很多听众可以采纳你的建议。

segments.en: OK, so I think it's time for us to listen to our dialogue one more time, this time at natural speed.
segments.cn: 好的，我想是时候让我们再听一遍对话，这次以自然速度。

segments.en: What are you doing in this neighborhood?
Actually, my office is right around the corner.
segments.cn: 其实，我的办公室就在拐角处。

segments.en: It was great to meet you last week at the conference.
segments.cn: 上周在会议上见到你很高兴。

segments.en: I really enjoyed our conversation about foreign investment.
segments.cn: 我真的很享受我们关于外国投资的对话。

segments.en: You know, I'm in a bit of a hurry, but here's my card.
segments.cn: 你知道，我有点赶时间，但这是我的名片。

segments.en: We should definitely meet up again and continue our discussion.
segments.cn: 我们一定要再见面，继续我们的讨论。

segments.en: You still have my contact details, right?
segments.cn: 你还记得我的联系方式，对吧？

segments.en: This is really embarrassing, but your name has just slipped my mind.
segments.cn: 这真的很尴尬，但我刚刚忘记了你的名字。

segments.en: It happens to me all the time.
Well, I hope that you've all enjoyed our lesson for today.
segments.cn: 好吧，我希望你们都喜欢今天的课程。

segments.en: And remember to check out our website at EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 记得查看我们的网站 EnglishPod.com。

segments.en: Where you can find a lot of other resources and you can leave all your questions and comments.
segments.cn: 在那里你可以找到很多其他资源，并可以留下你的问题和评论。

segments.en: Yeah, Marco and I are always on the site, so we're happy to answer all of your questions.
segments.cn: 是的，马尔科和我总是在网站上，所以我们很乐意回答你们的所有问题。

segments.en: So now it's time for us to say goodbye.
segments.cn: 现在是时候和大家说再见了。
